body.p: The skeletal system consists of several structures. There are 206 that form the majority of the system. Articulations are formed at the junction of two bones. Each bone is covered with a layer of for cushioning and shock absorption. The bones at the articulation are connected and stabilized with while connect the muscle to the bone. Each bone consists of cells termed , the protein which provides some flexibility and the minerals which provide bone strength. The is essential as it functions for hematopoiesis.

response.feedback: Correct. There are 206 bones that form the skeletal system.
Incorrect. Cartilage is a type of tissue.
Incorrect. Ligaments are not the majority of the system, they stabilize articulations.
Incorrect. Collagen is a type of fiber.

part.hint: Scroll up to review the anatomy of the skeletal system and to review any structures you have forgotten.

response.feedback: Correct. Cartilage tissue covers the ends of the bones.
Incorrect. Ligaments stabilize articulations, not cover them.
Incorrect. Collagen is a fiber that is part of bone tissue.
Incorrect. There is an extra layer covering the bones.

part.hint: Scroll up to review the anatomy of the skeletal system and to review any structures you have forgotten.

response.feedback: Correct. Ligaments stabilize articulations.
Incorrect. Cartilage covers the ends of the bones.
Incorrect. Tendons connect bones to muscles.
Incorrect. Bones need extra structures to stabilize the articulations.

part.hint: Scroll up to review the anatomy of the skeletal system and to review any structures you have forgotten.

response.feedback: Correct. Tendons connect muscle to bone.
Incorrect. Cartilage covers the end of the bones.
Incorrect. Ligaments stabilize articulations.
Incorrect. Bones need something to connect to muscles.

part.hint: Scroll up to review the anatomy of the skeletal system and to review any structures you have forgotten.

response.feedback: Correct. Osteocytes are the mature bone cells.
Incorrect. Calcium and phosphate are minerals.
Incorrect. Collagen is a protein.
Incorrect. Red bone marrow is in the inside space of the bone.

part.hint: Scroll up to review the anatomy of the integumentary system and to review any structures you have forgotten.

response.feedback: Correct. Collagen is a protein important for bone flexibility to tension.
Incorrect. Cartilage is a tissue.
Incorrect. Calcium and phosphates are minerals.
Incorrect. Osteocytes are cells.

part.hint: Scroll up to review the anatomy of the skeletal system and to review any structures you have forgotten.

response.feedback: Correct. Calcium and phosphate salts are the hard mineral components of bone.
Incorrect. Cartilage is a tissue.
Incorrect. Collagen is a protein.
Incorrect. Osteocytes are cells.

part.hint: Scroll up to review the anatomy of the skeletal system and to review any structures you have forgotten.

response.feedback: Correct. Hematopoiesis takes place in the red bone marrow.
Incorrect. Calcium and phosphate salts are the hard mineral components of bone.
Incorrect. Collagen is a protein that gives bone flexibility.
Incorrect. Osteocytes are cells that make up the bone.

part.hint: Scroll up to review the anatomy of the integumentary system and to review any structures you have forgotten.
